question.text: Is water available at the health facility?

question.text: What is the main water source for the health facility? (Tick one)

question.name: Water supply location
question.text: Where is the main water supply for the facility located?

question.name: Water supply availability (during the survey)
question.text: Is water available at the health facility at all times?

question.name: Is the water available enough for all uses at the health facility?
question.text: Is the water available enough for all uses at the health facility?

question.name: Water is always availabe
question.text: Is the water always available at the water source

question.name: Is safe, clean water available from a tap or container
question.text: Is safe, clean water available from a tap or container

question.name: Are there toilets at the health facility?
question.text: Are there toilets at the health facility?

question.name: Type of toilets / latrines
question.text: What type of toilets/latrines are at the facility for patients?

question.name: If Flush/pour flush, where does it flush to?
question.text: If Flush/pour flush, where does it flush to?

question.name: Usablility of the toilets
question.text: Are the toilets at the health facility useable (accessible, functional and private)?

question.name: Number of usable toilets
question.text: How many toilets are available at the outpatient department?

question.name: Dedicated for staff toilets
question.text: Are there toilets that are dedicated for staff?

question.name: Gender-separated toilets
question.text: Are there toilets separated by gender?

question.name: Is there at least one toilet or improved latrine that provides the means to manage menstrual hygiene needs?
question.text: Is there at least one toilet or improved latrine that provides the means to manage menstrual hygiene needs?

question.name: The toilets having menstrual hygiene facilities
question.text: Are there toilets that have menstrual hygiene facilities?

question.name: The toilets accessible for people with limited mobility
question.text: Are there toilets that are accessible for people with special needs and disabilities?

question.name: Is there a cleaning roster displayed?
question.text: Is there a cleaning roster displayed?

question.name: Functional hand hygiene facility availabilty
question.text: Are functioning hand hygiene stations (that is, alcohol-based hand rub solution or soap and water and clean single-use towels) available at all points of care?

option.name: No, there are hand hygiene facilities at points of care but not functional, or lacking soap and water or alcohol-based hand rub.
No, no hand hygiene facilities at points of care
No, no hand hygiene facilities at the health care facility

question.name: Are there Functioning hand hygiene stations within 5 m of latrines?
question.text: Are there Functioning hand hygiene stations within 5 m of latrines?

question.name: Functional handwashing facility availabilty at toilets
question.text: Is there a functional handwashing facility at one or more toilets on the day of the survey?

option.name: No, there are handwashing facilities near the toilets but lacking soap and/or water
No, no handwashing facilities near toilets (within 5 meters)

question.name: Are Functioning hand hygiene stations available in waste disposal area?
question.text: Are Functioning hand hygiene stations available in waste disposal area?

question.name: Cleaning protocols is available
question.text: Does the facility have a hygiene protocol?

question.name: Does the hygiene protocol have a dedicated staff roster?
question.text: Does the hygiene protocol have a dedicated staff roster?

question.name: Cleaning staff is trained
question.text: Have all staff responsible for cleaning received training?

option.name: No, some but not all have been trained
No, there are no staff responsible for cleaning

question.name: Staff cleaning responsible to equipped PPEs
question.text: Are the staff responsible for cleaning equipped with all the necessary PPEs?

question.name: Do you have single patient rooms or rooms for cohorting patients with similar pathogens (for example, TB, measles, cholera, Ebola, SARS)?
question.text: Do you have single patient rooms or rooms for cohorting patients with similar pathogens (for example, TB, measles, cholera, Ebola, SARS)?

option.name: No single rooms but rather rooms suitable for patient cohorting available.

question.name: Is PPE available at all times and in sufficient quantity for all uses for all health care workers?
question.text: Is PPE available at all times and in sufficient quantity for all uses for all health care workers?

option.name: Yes, but not continuously available in sufficient quantities
Yes, continuously available in sufficient quantities

question.name: Sanitary products available for patiens in case of emergency
question.text: Does the facility have menstrual hygiene materials available for patients who needs?

question.name: Does the facility have Hand hygiene promotion materials clearly visible and understandable at key places?
question.text: Does the facility have Hand hygiene promotion materials clearly visible and understandable at key places?

question.name: For floors and horizontal work surfaces, is there an accessible record of cleaning, signed by the cleaners?
question.text: For floors and horizontal work surfaces, is there an accessible record of cleaning, signed by the cleaners?

question.name: For floors and horizontal work surfaces, is there an accessible record of cleaning, counter signed by supervisors each day?
question.text: For floors and horizontal work surfaces, is there an accessible record of cleaning, counter signed by supervisors each day?

question.name: Are there appropriate and well-maintained materials for cleaning (for example, detergent, mops, buckets, etc.) available?
question.text: Are there appropriate and well-maintained materials for cleaning (for example, detergent, mops, buckets, etc.) available?

question.name: Does your health care facility provide a dedicated decontamination area and/or sterile supply department?
question.text: Does your health care facility provide a dedicated decontamination area and/or sterile supply department?

question.name: Do you always have sterile and disinfected equipment ready for use?
question.text: Do you always have sterile and disinfected equipment ready for use?

question.name: Waste correctly segregated into at least thee labelled bins
question.text: Is waste correctly segregated into at least three labelled bins in the consultation area?

option.name: Yes, waste is segregated into three labelled bins
No, bins are present but do not meet all requirements or waste is not correctly segregated

question.name: Do you have a reliable sterilization and disinfection equipment?
question.text: Do you have a reliable sterilization and disinfection equipment?

question.name: Having edequate waste collection bins
question.text: Does the health facility have adequate waste collection bins

options: Yes, waste is segregated into three labelled bins
No, bins are present but do not meet all requirements or waste is not correctly segregated

question.name: Is there appropriate personal protective equipment for all staff handling health care waste (heat/heavy duty protective gloves, googles, respirators, heavy duty boots,protective foot wear, overalls and helmet)?
question.text: Is there appropriate personal protective equipment for all staff handling health care waste (heat/heavy duty protective gloves, googles, respirators, heavy duty boots,protective foot wear, overalls and helmet)?

option.name: Yes, but not all the required PPEs

question.name: Functional incinerator is present
question.text: Is there a functional  incinerator  present at the facility?

question.name: Functional placenta pits is present
question.text: Are there functional placenta pits  present at the facility?

question.name: Dispose of infectious waste
question.text: How does this facility usually treat/ dispose of infectious waste?

option.name: Collected for medical waste disposal off-site
Added to general waste without treatment

question.name: Dispose of sharps waste
question.text: How does this facility usually treat/ dispose of sharps waste?

option.name: Collected for medical waste disposal off-site
Added to general waste without treatment

question.name: Trained staff on HCWM
question.text: Are there trained staff on HCWM

question.text: Are staff members vaccinated against hepatitis B

question.text: Does the health facility have waste transportation trolys

question.text: Does the health facilty have waste transportation vehicles

question.name: Is a wastewater treatment system (for example, septic tank followed by drainage pit) present?
question.text: Is a wastewater treatment system (for example, septic tank followed by drainage pit) present?

question.name: Is a wastewater treatment system functioning reliably?
question.text: Is a wastewater treatment system functioning reliably?

question.name: Is a functional burial pit/fenced waste dump or municipal pick-up available for disposal of non-infectious (non-hazardous/ general waste)?
question.text: Is a functional burial pit/fenced waste dump or municipal pick-up available for disposal of non-infectious (non-hazardous/ general waste)?

option.name: No pit or other disposal method available
Yes, Pit in facility but insufficient dimensions; pits/dumps overfilled or not fenced/locked; or irregular municipal waste pick up
Yes, functional pit/municipal pick up available

question.name: Are staff handling waste vaccinated against Hepatitis B,COVID-19 and Tetanus?
question.text: Are staff handling waste vaccinated against Hepatitis B,COVID-19 and Tetanus?
